question.title: What is the primary function of the III cranial nerve in controlling eye movements?
question.description: The III cranial nerve is responsible for controlling eye movements. What is its primary function?

option_a.title: To control the muscles that rotate the eyeball
option_a.description: The III cranial nerve controls the lateral rectus muscle, which rotates the eyeball outward.

option_b.title: To control the muscles that rotate the eyeball inward
option_b.description: The III cranial nerve controls the medial rectus muscle, which rotates the eyeball inward.

option_c.title: To control the muscles that elevate the eyeball
option_c.description: The III cranial nerve controls the superior rectus muscle, which elevates the eyeball.

option_d.title: To control the muscles that depress the eyeball
option_d.description: The III cranial nerve controls the inferior rectus muscle, which depresses the eyeball.
